poem:
### The Voice of Pem

From depths of childhood smoke,  
a voice unspools—husky, unruly thread—  
shaping songs on London nights,  
notes loosening from the tight knot  
of a practiced larynx. Emily, unstrung.  
Each chord strikes, echoes along  
alleyways of yearning,  
a therapist of sound,  
prescribing harmonies to hearts,  
a singer unsmoking silence.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "One to watch: Pem “Since I was 10, my teachers asked my parents if I smoked!” Pem is trying to explain where her enthralling, vibrato-rippling voice comes from. Pem (short for Emily Perry) always had a husky tone, and while training to be a therapist after her degree she began to put what she calls her “loose larynx” to work, recording the gripping, emotional music she’d been playing at London open mic nights. Growing up". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
